cGFnZS10aXRsZV9Ib3cgY2FuIHdlIGhlbHAgeW91.text: How can we help you cope with this climate?

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9XaGF0IHdpbGwgYmUgdGhl.text: What will be the most suitable crops in Africa and Central America?

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9BZnJpY2FuIGF1dGhvcml0.text: African authorities use satellite data to prevent floods in West Africa

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9QcmVkaWN0aW5nIHBsYWd1.text: Predicting plague outbreaks two months in advance

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9CdWlsZGluZyB0aGUgbmV4.text: Building the next European cloud for Earth observation

bWFya2V0LXN1bW1hcnlfV2Ugc3VwcG9ydCByaXNr.text: We support risk mitigation strategies for companies to anticipate the effects of climate change in their investments.

bWFya2V0LXN1bW1hcnlfV2UgcHJvdmlkZSBjbGlt.text: We provide climatic scenarios, predictions and decision-making tools to public authorities so they can strengthen their planning and catalyse actions across society.

bWFya2V0LXN1bW1hcnlfV2UgYW5hbHlzZSBoaWdo.text: We analyse highly-complex datasets to generate climate projections and monitoring tools to assess adaptation plans and strategies.

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9FdmFsdWF0aW5nIHRoZSBl.text: Evaluating the economic impact of extreme storms in the next 50 years

cGFnZS10aXRsZV9TYXRlbGxpdGUgZGF0YSBhbmQg.text: Satellite data and computational intelligence to address climate challenges

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9IZWxwaW5nIGNpdGllcyB0.text: Helping cities to *turn green* with air quality knowledge from satellites

cGFnZS1jb250ZW50c19XZSB1c2UgRWFydGggT2Jz.text: We use Earth Observation data and climate projections for the assessment of **vulnerabilities, risks and opportunities associated to climate scenarios** for each particular case and region of interest. We work on monitoring, forecasting and planning, often from open and free data acquired by European satellites under the Copernicus programme.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19DbGltYXRlIGNoYW5n.text: Climate change is expected to disproportionately affect smallholder farmers, who already face numerous risks to their agricultural production. Crop varieties will respond differently to changes in temperature and precipitation at the locations where they are currently grown. A **crop suitability index** is an important component of assessment studies, including changes to geographical crop distribution under climate change in the coming decades.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18qKiBJbiBjb2xsYWJv.text: ** In collaboration with Oxfam, Lobelia has developed a crop suitability tool to assess the future of staple crops in different regions.**

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19NYWl6ZSAvIHNvcmdo.text: Maize / sorghum / pearl millet / rice / cassava / beans / groundnuts / yam

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19gYGBCdXR0b24KbGFi.text:
```Button
label: try demo
url: https://crop-suitability-demo.lobelia.earth/{lang}
langs:
- en
- es
- ca
- fr
```

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Mb2JlbGlhIGhhcyBk.text: Lobelia has developed a system to predict trends of extreme climate events at specific locations. The system is fed with observations and climate models, as well as reanalysis and satellite datasets. Data sources include leading European meteorological agencies, ECMWF, Sentinel imagery and various local data providers.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19XZSB1c2UgKipjb21w.text: We use **computational intelligence techniques** to find patterns in the climate models that correlate with the temporal density of extreme events in the past, according to real observations from meteorological agencies. These results are then projected into the future according to the existing climate models.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19PdXIgc3R1ZGllcyBo.text: Our studies have found that the evolution in time of the probabilities of occurrence differ substantially depending on the event (e.g. extraordinary winds, cyclones and extreme storms) and the location. Specific studies are required in every context to obtain optimum results for each extreme event category.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18qKkxvYmVsaWEgY29s.text: **Lobelia collaborates with PwC on the economic assessment of potential damages derived from extreme climate events.**

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19gYGBCdXR0b24KbGFi.text:
```Button
label: request a demo
url: mailto:info@lobelia.earth
```

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19GbG9vZHMgYXJlIGEg.text: Floods are a rapidly growing concern in West Africa, projected to increase with climate change. There is a great need for reliable access to operational flood forecasts and alerts, produced by a robust information and communication system, adapted to regional conditions and operated by capable West African institutions.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19UaGUgRUMtZnVuZGVk.text: The EC-funded FANFAR project aims at building such a system. In this context, Lobelia's **satellite-based water level products** of the Niger River basin floodplain are sequentially assimilated into a hydrological model from the Swedish Meteorological and Hydrological Institute (SMHI) to generate river discharge return periods. These results are then used in SMHI’s flood forecasting and early-warning alert system in West Africa.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19gYGBCdXR0b24KbGFi.text:
```Button
label: learn more
url: http://fanfar.eu
newTab: true
```

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19BIHN3YXJtIG1lYXN1.text: A swarm measuring one square kilometre contains about 40 million locusts, which eat the same amount of food in one day as approximately 35,000 people.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Nb3JlIHRoYW4gOCBt.text: More than 8 million people in West Africa were affected during the 2003-2005 plague, in which cereal crops were wiped out and up to 90% of legumes and pasture were destroyed. It took nearly $600 million and 13 million litres of pesticide to bring it under control.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19TYXRlbGxpdGUgZGF0.text: Satellite data is being used in a novel way to predict favourable conditions for desert locust swarms. The new technology, largely based on **high-resolution soil moisture** data, helps to increase the warning time for locust outbreaks by up to two months.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19BIG5ldyB0b29sIHdh.text: A new tool was developed by isardSAT and Cirad, under a contract with the European Space Agency, to monitor and forecast the conditions that can lead to locust swarms, such as high moisture and green vegetation. Swarming occurs when a period of drought is followed by abundant rains and rapid vegetation growth. Results were validated in Algeria, Mali, Mauritania and Morocco in coordination with National Authorities and FAO.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19EdXJpbmcgdGhlIGxh.text: During the latest outbreak in Mauritania (2016), the team was able to identify a time lag of about 70 days from the initial signs of soil moisture to when the outbreak eventually occurred. These results were obtained using Earth observation data from the **operational soil moisture service with global coverage operated today by Lobelia**.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19gYGBCdXR0b24KbGFi.text:
```Button
label: learn more
url: http://smells.isardsat.com/
newTab: true
```

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19PbmUgb2YgdGhlIG1v.text: One of the most frequently heard phrases in Earth Observation is “bringing the algorithms to the data”. Given the increasingly large datasets provided by Sentinel satellites and Copernicus services, platforms are emerging that do just that: helping users run their processing chains as close as possible to the data they need — no need to wait for huge downloads before even starting.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18qKkxvYmVsaWEgY29s.text: **Lobelia collaborates with Mercator Océan International aiding Earth Observation users to get the most out of [WEkEO](https://wekeo.eu)**, the Data and Information Access Services (DIAS) platform developed by EUMETSAT, ECMWF and Mercator itself. Lobelia is also deeply involved in monitoring the various services, as well as gathering feedback for the next releases of the platform.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19gYGBCdXR0b24KbGFi.text:
```Button
label: learn more
url: https://wekeo.eu
newTab: true
```

bWFya2V0LXN1bW1hcnlfUmVzZWFyY2ggYW5kIGlu.text: Research and innovation promotes a well-balanced, sustainable growth. We provide solutions based on a scientifically responsible approach.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19VcmJhbiBhcmVhcyBh.text: Urban areas are strongly exposed to the effects of climate change. Local authorities monitor these effects very closely, so that they can adapt in a timely manner and reduce their impact on citizens' lives: health care, transport, water management, energy supply, etc.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Mb2JlbGlhIHVzZXMg.text: Lobelia uses downscaling and bias correction techniques to generate high-resolution, locally-adapted data describing the future climate in the target cities.

cGFnZS1jb250ZW50c18qKkxvYmVsaWEgYnkgaXNh.text: **Lobelia by isardSAT** ("Lobelia" hereafter) publishes the **Lobelia Air** mobile app (the "Service" hereafter) and its local variants, e.g. *Aire Barcelona*, as a free app for all users. This Service is provided by Lobelia at no cost and is intended for use as is.

cGFnZS1jb250ZW50c19UaGlzIHBhZ2UgaXMgdXNl.text: This page is used to inform users regarding our policies with the collection, use, and disclosure of Personal Information if anyone decided to use the Service.

cGFnZS1jb250ZW50c19JZiB5b3UgY2hvb3NlIHRv.text: If you choose to use the Service, then you agree to the collection and use of information in relation with this policy. The Personal Information that we collect is used for improving the Service. We will not use or share your information with anyone except as described in this Privacy Policy.

cGFnZS1jb250ZW50c19UaGUgU2VydmljZSByZXF1.text: The Service requires no user registration and collects **no personally identifiable information whatsoever**. The Service asks for permission to obtain the user location from the operating system, in order to provide air quality information at that particular location, but does not store or relay that information outside the user's device.

cGFnZS1jb250ZW50c19UaGUgU2VydmljZSBkb2Vz.text: The Service does however use a third-party service, Google Analytics (the "Analytics Service" hereafter), to study usage patterns and improve the Service. The Analytics Service collects usage information, such as sessions, session durations and user events. These usage records are stored and aggregated by Google. Please also refer to [Google Analytics Terms of Service](https://www.google.com/analytics/terms/us.html), including privacy considerations.

cGFnZS1jb250ZW50c19BcGFydCBmcm9tIHRoZSBB.text: Apart from the Analytics Service, and the App Stores used for publishing the app, the Service does not use any other Service Providers nor shares any kind of information with other companies or individuals.

cGFnZS1jb250ZW50c19XZSB2YWx1ZSB5b3VyIHRy.text: We value your trust in providing us your Personal Information, thus we are striving to use commercially acceptable means of protecting it. But remember that no method of transmission over the internet, or method of electronic storage is 100% secure and reliable, and we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

cGFnZS1jb250ZW50c19UaGlzIFNlcnZpY2UgbWF5.text: This Service may contain links to other sites. If you click on a third-party link, you will be directed to that site. Note that these external sites are not operated by us. Therefore, we strongly advise you to review the Privacy Policy of these websites. We have no control over, and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third-party sites or services.

cGFnZS1jb250ZW50c19UaGlzIFNlcnZpY2UgZG9l.text: This Service does not address anyone under the age of 13. We do not collect personal identifiable information from any user of any age.

cGFnZS1jb250ZW50c19XZSBtYXkgdXBkYXRlIG91.text: We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. Thus, you are advised to review this page periodically for any changes. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page. These changes are effective immediately, after they are posted on this page.

cGFnZS1jb250ZW50c19JZiB5b3UgaGF2ZSBhbnkg.text: If you have any questions or suggestions about our Privacy Policy, do not hesitate to [contact us](https://www.lobelia.earth/contact).

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19BaXJRYXN0IG9mZmVy.text: AirQast offers a portfolio of air quality products derived from satellite data. Originating from a European H2020 project, AirQast includes some of the most renowned European actors in air pollution research.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18qKkxvYmVsaWEgb3Bl.text: **Lobelia operates the AirQast platform and provides air quality services at urban scales.**

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Nb250aGx5IHJlZ2lv.text: Monthly regional emission inventories from satellites at 1-km resolution.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Ib3VybHkgYWlyIHF1.text: Hourly air quality forecasts for 3 days in advance.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19DaGluYSAvIEluZGlh.text: China / India / Europe / other regions upon demand.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19BaXIgcG9sbHV0aW9u.text: Air pollution is a serious problem traced to 3 million deaths worldwide every year. It also causes yearly costs in the order of billions of euros, considering lost productivity and health expenses. Finally, pollution impacts negatively on aspects such as transport (e.g. lack of visibility in airports), city maintenance (e.g. infrastructure cleaning) and agriculture (e.g. pollutant depositions).

```Button
label: learn more
url: http://airqast.com
newTab: true
```

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19BbiBpbnRlcmFjdGl2.text: An interactive map providing authorities and citizens with an urban x-ray of the hotspots, the impact of traffic, energy production and waste management in cities. Our state-of-the-art technology combines observations, satellite and traffic data, among others.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18qKkxvYmVsaWEqKiBp.text: **Lobelia** is created to respond to the societal needs for regulatory measures to confront the climate emergency. The Kyoto protocol and COP21 are just two of the major forums where decisions have been made internationally to work collaboratively, address climate-based challenges and set up a path for a new economy. This new economy takes into account our collective responsibility with respect to the impact of climate change upon private sector operations and public policy. One example is the European Directive for the disclosure of non-financial information for large groups and the commitment of major investment firms to environmentally sustainable outcomes.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19XaXRoIG1vcmUgdGhh.text: With more than ten years of experience, **isardSAT** is a leading expert on satellite technologies, satellite mission design and implementation as well as on proprietary algorithms for the application of satellite technology for environmental issues, and is now proud to present its new climate services unit: *Lobelia*.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Mb2JlbGlhIGhhcyBi.text: Lobelia has been created with the clear objective of putting satellite data, computational intelligence and climate information to use for the creation of strategic plans and adaption measures in the face of climate emergency.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Ub2RheSwgdGhlIHRl.text: Today, the team at Lobelia is composed of passionate experts in physics, earth science, graphic design, data visualisation and computational intelligence. We work with trusted data providers and have a growing network of international collaborators that are as engaged as we are to drive for change.

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9HbG9iYWwgY29hc3RhbCBl.text: Global coastal erosion maps: 25 years of satellite data and over 1,000 km of coastline

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19UaGUgY29hc3RhbCBl.text: The coastal environment is constantly changing. Climate change with storm surges, rapid sea level rise, floods, and so forth impacts the coastline and through shoreline inland migration has a substantial economic and human impact. It requires management and monitoring.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18qKlRoZSBDb2FzdGFs.text: **The Coastal Change from Space** team is developing innovative Earth Observation (EO) products/information in response to authoritative requirements from end-users in charge of Coastal Erosion studies and mitigation.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19BcyBwYXJ0IG9mIHRo.text: As part of the team, we are preparing the ground for long-term exploitation of remote sensing from space by large user communities and will provide substantial and concrete benefits to the targeted user communities when analysing the trends of coastal erosion and accretion as well as the vulnerability of the coast.

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9DbGltYXRlIEV4cGxvcmVy.text: Climate Explorer – visualizing climate data worldwide

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19BbiBpbnRlcmFjdGl2.text: An interactive, easy-to-understand map to browse global climate.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19DaG9vc2UgYSBsb2Nh.text: Choose a location and discover temperature, precipitation, frost days, warm nights, rainy days, relative humidity, wind speed and gusts and cloud cover.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19UaGUgY2xpbWF0ZSBl.text: The climate explorer uses ERA5 data from ECMWF. ERA5 combines vast amounts of historical observations into global estimates using advanced modelling and data assimilation systems.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18qKk9oLCBhbmQgYnkg.text: **Oh, and by the way: no registration is required.**

cHJvamVjdC1zaWRlYmFyQ29udGVudHNfRW1tYSBh.text: Emma at the Global Climate Strike, September 2019: More teleconfs, less flying! © Lobelia Earth

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18qKkV2ZXJ5IHRpbWUg.text: **Every time you enter a Lobelia Connect room, you'll see the estimated amount of CO₂ you and your colleagues are sparing the Earth.**

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18jIyBIb3cgaXMgdGhl.text: ## How is the amount of CO₂ calculated?

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Zb3Ugd2FrZSB1cCBh.text: You wake up at 5 am, rush to the airport and take the first plane to some faraway place to discuss with ten yawning colleagues over the next few hours. You then fly back home, looking out the window and thinking: _We could've done a Webex instead! It's nice shaking hands every once in a while, but every other month? Why do 10 people need to fly around to do what they basically can do from the office? And of course: forgetting about the ongoing climate crisis and dumping tons of CO₂ to the atmosphere._

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Mb2JlbGlhIENvbm5l.text: Lobelia Connect first determines the optimum location for the equivalent real-life meeting, using IP geolocation to know *more or less* where each participant is. It then determines the amount of CO₂ needed for all participants to get there. In some cases, no travelling will be involved. In others, and depending on the distance, the two-way carbon footprint is calculated:

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18qKkJ5IGNhcjoqKiAo.text: **By car:** (one-way distance below 400 km): 120.4 g/km per person (average emissions for new cars registered in 2018 in the EU + Iceland; source: [EC](https://ec.europa.eu/clima/policies/transport/vehicles/cars_en))

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18qKkJ5IHBsYW5lOioq.text: **By plane:** 115 or 101 g/km per person, for short-haul (Boeing 737-400) and long-haul (Boeing 747-400) flights, respectively, plus a 2x radiative factor that accounts for the fact that emissions into the high atmosphere have a higher greenhouse effect (source: [Ian Campbell & Margaret Campbell, ClimateIndependent.org](https://www.carbonindependent.org/22.html))

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9Mb2JlbGlhIENvbm5lY3Qg.text: Lobelia Connect – videoconferencing with a conscience

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18qKlJlc3QgYXNzdXJl.text: **Rest assured: we don't.** The full application is serverless, connections are established peer-to-peer and signalling messages are exchanged via PubNub, anonymously. IP geolocations are requested by your browser directly (and anonymously) to a third-party service, over a secure channel.

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9Mb2JlbGlhIEFpciDigJMg.text: Lobelia Air – NO₂ and PM concentrations at street level

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18qKkhvdyBnb29kIGlz.text: **How good is the air we breathe?**

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19DaXRpemVucyBjYW4g.text: Citizens can find the most recent air quality maps and time series. The tool also helps determine the best moment to go somewhere —maybe the daily commute—, or choose a place to go where the air is cleaner.

cGFnZS1jb250ZW50c19Xb3JkcyBpbiB0aGUgc2lu.text: Words in the singular include the plural and vice versa.

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9TdXBwb3J0aW5nIFVOwqBI.text: Supporting UN Habitat – CRPT for climate analysis in cities

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19VTiBIYWJpdGF0J3Mg.text: UN Habitat's **City Resilience Profiling Programme (CRPT)** provides national and local governments with tools for measuring and increasing resilience to multi-hazard impacts, including those associated with climate change.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18qKkxvYmVsaWEncyBj.text: **Lobelia's climate engine is integrated in the CRPT**, helping analyse climate trends and link to other types of data as required to allow the definition of a suitable action plan. Lobelia's toolbox can be used by cities worldwide, with current users including Asunción, Yakutsk, Maputo, Dakar and Port Vila.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19bKipEb3dubG9hZCB0.text: [**Download the Lobelia Air Barcelona NO₂ reanalysis dataset >**](https://observablehq.com/@lobeliaearth/hourly-street-level-no2-concentrations-in-barcelona-2018)

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9QbGFzdGljIGRldGVjdGlv.text: Plastic detection from satellites in oceans worldwide

cHJvamVjdC1zaG9ydFRpdGxlX1BsYXN0aWMgZGV0.text: Plastic detection from satellites in oceans worldwide

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Mb2JlbGlhIEVhcnRo.text: Lobelia Earth uses Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) images for the identification of plastic signatures in marine environments. Space-borne radar technology ocean remote sensing has indisputable benefits since it provides an all-weather, all-day (independent of sunlight), wide-swath monitoring of the sea.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19XZSBjb21iaW5lIGRp.text: We combine different types of information gathered by the radar sensor and use algorithms to enhance the detection of marine debris in combination with meteorological information, employing a pattern recognition approach based on computational intelligence techniques. This enables the generation of a data-driven model trained and validated for the study area, the Balearic Islands, and the testing of model generalisation with other reported plastic pollution events in different scenarios and geographical locations.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c18qKlRoZSBjbG91ZC1i.text: **The cloud-based [Hydrology Thematic Exploitation Platform (H-TEP)](https://hydrology-tep.eu/guest/) operates this flood warning system.** Lobelia's satellite-based, global water level service runs on the H-TEP and is well-suited to complement in-situ sensor networks. It can also be used as a proxy of streamflow, for model calibration and validation as well as for hydrologic data assimilation.

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtdGl0bGVfQ09WSUQtMTkgbG9j.text: COVID-19 lockdown: air pollution in cities

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtY29tcGFyaXNvblNlY3Rpb25U.text: Comparison of average NO₂ concentrations, before and during lockdowns

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtY29tcGFyaXNvblNlY3Rpb25D.text: A clear decrease in NO₂ concentrations in Madrid and Barcelona during the lockdown period. In the case of Madrid it seems clear that this decrease is due to the decrease in traffic. In the case of Barcelona, the NO₂ forecast was already very low for these days due to weather conditions. A detailed study is necessary to determine the contribution of traffic to this decline. A preliminary analysis can be found below.

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtY29tcGFyaXNvblNlY3Rpb25G.text: \* These interactives will be updated daily.

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtZXZvbHV0aW9uU2VjdGlvbkZv.text: Original data sampling rate is 1 measurement per hour. The time lapse shows a 48 hours moving average with a frame every 4 hours. The moving average intends to enhance the visualization of the global trend of NO₂ concentrations and won't show the daily peaks.

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtZXZvbHV0aW9uU2VjdGlvblRp.text: Evolution of NO₂ concentrations before and during lockdown

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtYW5hbHlzaXNTZWN0aW9uVGl0.text: Preliminary analysis of the impact of lockdown regulations

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtYW5hbHlzaXNTZWN0aW9uSW50.text: In order to understand the actual contribution of the lockdown regulations to the improvement of air quality, a comparison has been made between the NO₂ forecast which reflects the “Business as usual” emission scenario ([Copernicus Atmosphere Monitoring Service](https://atmosphere.copernicus.eu/) forecast ensemble), and the measured urban background concentration. The black line shows the concentrations as they would be without any COVID-19 regulations, while the yellow line shows the actual measuremets from the reference network stations ([Open Data Madrid](https://datos.madrid.es/portal/site/egob/menuitem.c05c1f754a33a9fbe4b2e4b284f1a5a0/?vgnextoid=9e42c176313eb410VgnVCM1000000b205a0aRCRD&vgnextchannel=374512b9ace9f310VgnVCM100000171f5a0aRCRD&vgnextfmt=default), [Government of Catalonia station network](http://www.gencat.cat/mediamb/qaire/web/ZQA/1_zona_bcn.pdf)):

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtYW5hbHlzaXNNYWRyaWRUaXRs.text: What does the Madrid graph show?

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtYW5hbHlzaXNCYXJjZWxvbmFU.text: What does the Barcelona graph show?

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtYW5hbHlzaXNNYWRyaWRDb250.text: Madrid presents a clear decrease of NO₂ in-situ concentrations with respect to those forecasted, and therefore it is reasonable to assume that the low levels of NO₂ pollution are greatly due to the lockdown restrictions. The shaded area shows the difference between the expected NO₂  concentration and real measurements. It suggests a reduction in NO₂ of over 40%.

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtYW5hbHlzaXNCYXJjZWxvbmFD.text: The NO₂ concentrations in Barcelona are clearly low during the lockdown period. However, a strong decrease in pollution was expected anyway during the first days of the lockdown due to favourable meteorological conditions (i.e. rain, wind speed and direction). In the case of Barcelona, more data is necessary to make an accurate assessment of the influence of the lockdown in the overall NO₂ concentration decrease.

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtYW5hbHlzaXNCYXJjZWxvbmFS.text: ### Barcelona: How do inner-city concentrations reduce with respect to background levels?

This graph shows that before the lockdown period, nearby traffic contributes around 20 µg/m³ (40%) to local NO₂ concentrations. This contribution almost disappears after March 14th when regulations are enforced.

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2Utb3RoZXJDaXRpZXNTZWN0aW9u.text: What can be expected in other cities?

The following graphs show the same comparison for a number of selected cities, where the shaded areas represent significative differences between the NO₂ expected and the actual concentrations. Concentration reductions are especially visible for cities which would have high pollution levels without the lockdown measures (Milano, Madrid, Paris). In Barcelona, Berlin and Amsterdam the effect of the lockdown is not visible; these cities would have had clean air anyhow in the last couple of weeks.

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2Utbm90ZUZvclByb2Zlc3Npb25h.text: We are a small company located in Barcelona, in love with satellites, computers, scientific communication and our planet. We process and publish air quality and climate data. If you are interested and want to learn more, please contact us at [info@lobelia.earth](mailto:info@lobelia.earth).

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtY3JlZGl0c0ludHJvX1RoaXMg.text: This site reflects the work of Lobelia Earth and the Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute (KNMI) on urban air quality during COVID-19 lockdowns.

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtYWJzdHJhY3RfTW9zdCBvZiB0.text: Most of the nitrogen dioxide (NO₂) we breathe daily in our cities is generated by ourselves. It is generated in combustion processes such as heating and cooking, but most of the NO₂ in our streets comes from motor vehicle exhaust.

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtYWJzdHJhY3RfTk/igoIgaXMg.text: NO₂ is linked to an increased likelihood of respiratory problems. It inflames the lining of the lungs, and can reduce immunity to lung infections, paving the way for colds, flu and bronchitis. On people with asthma, it can cause more frequent and intense attacks. Children with asthma and older people with heart disease are most at risk.

Y292aWQxOVBhZ2UtYW5hbHlzaXNCYXJjZWxvbmFS.text: Effective measures will decrease the local contributions in air pollution (mainly traffic) so they will resemble more the background values. These can clearly be seen in the Eixample street station in Barcelona.¶

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19UaGUgW0NvcGVybmlj.text: The [Copernicus Marine Environment Monitoring Service (CMEMS)](https://marine.copernicus.eu/) distils quality-approved ocean analyses and forecasts from satellite and in-situ observations. Fully operational since 2015 and managed by [Mercator Océan International](https://www.mercator-ocean.fr/), CMEMS is used daily by a large community worldwide.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19NYWtpbmcgQ01FTVMg.text: Making CMEMS products more accessible to this community is the goal of the new [CMEMS Viewer](https://cmems.lobelia.earth) built by Lobelia. Based on its own TeroMaps mapping engine, the CMEMS Viewer provides multi-projection views for the 3500+ data layers, as well as powerful yet easy-to-use analysis tools.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19JbiB0aGUgZm9sbG93.text: In the following interactive example, a researcher may quickly discover patterns in sea water temperature in the Kara and Norwegian Seas, thanks to time series, depth profiles and time-depth plots. Feel free to pan-zoom, change time and elevation, or even drag points and vertices:

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19EZXNwaXRlIHRoZSBh.text: Despite the aridity of the climate, floods are quite frequent in Kazakhstan. Several hundreds of floods caused  by different phenomena (e.g. spring thaw and rainfall) have been recorded in Kazakhstan over the past decades. Still, the problem of flooding, and above all the issue of full-scale protection against its destructive impact, are yet to be resolved. For example, recent studies from the capital Nur-Sultan (formerly known as Astana)  show that infrequent floods along river Ishim can reach extremely high-water levels with potential damaging  effects on the infrastructure, human lives and livelihoods.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Mb2JlbGlhIEVhcnRo.text: Lobelia Earth, in collaboration with DHI, provided water level information that supports improved flood  simulations and calculation of water volumes in reservoirs for the Nura and the Ishim river basin, and ultimately support flood protection programmes and its corresponding risk assessments.

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9UaGVybWFsIFN0cmVzcyBp.text: Thermal Stress in the Climate Crisis: a Story Hub

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19UaGVybWFsIHN0cmVz.text: Thermal stress due to extremes of heat or cold can negatively impact human health.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19FeHRyZW1lIGhlYXQs.text: Extreme heat, for instance, is responsible for a variety of risks, including dehydration, cramps, and even death, especially during heat waves. Mortality and health problems, such as frostbite and hypothermia, can also result from exposure to extreme cold. UTCI knowledge is key to assess heat-related and cold-related health risk.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19UaGUgVW5pdmVyc2Fs.text: The Universal Thermal Climate Index (UTCI) is a thermal comfort indicator based on human heat balance models.   It is designed to be applicable in all seasons and climates and for all spatial and temporal scales. It takes into account temperature, relative humidity, solar radiation and wind speed data.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Mb2JlbGlhIEVhcnRo.text: Lobelia Earth is calculating future projections of UTCI until 2100, using CMIP data. A website is being designed to present a UTCI data viewer with past and current data, as well as future projections. Interactive visual stories related to the UTCI will be presented, written in a factual but also conversational discourse, thus approaching the topic to the general public and contributing to communicate the Climate Emergency.

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9BZGRyZXNzaW5nIGRyb3Vn.text: Addressing drought at its very earlier stages.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19HbG9iYWwgaGlnaCBz.text: Global high spatio-temporal resolution monitoring of earth’s natural resources is key in the assessment of climate change intensification. A pivotal variable is soil moisture estimation for continuous vigilance of climatological, hydrological and agricultural phenomena as well as for extreme events forecast such as drought, wildfires and floods. Soil moisture is a precursor parameter in these processes and early anomaly detection empowers strategic decisions for environmental policies in mitigating natural disasters consequences.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Mb2JlbGlhIEVhcnRo.text: Lobelia Earth in collaboration with isardSAT is creating a service that provides long-term time series as well as anomalies of soil moisture and drought indexes to plan the water availability over a wide range of areas. isardSAT’s High-Resolution Soil Moisture algorithm is being used during the overlapping period and for the monitoring of the area. The platform will provide historical and current data to predict future changes and a water availability alarm that uses very high-resolution soil moisture. The service is built on top of in-situ information of soil moisture conditions running with [Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S)](https://www.copernicus.eu/en/services/climate-change) projections of climate change.

cHJvamVjdC11bmZ1cmxUaXRsZV9BZGRyZXNzaW5n.text: Addressing drought at its very earlier stages.

cHJvamVjdC10aXRsZV9MaW5raW5nIG1hcmluZSBs.text: Linking marine litter ground truth and remote sensing data. A plastic database from earth and space

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Mb2JlbGlhIEVhcnRo.text: Lobelia Earth is creating a platform that integrates observations of marine plastic in a labelled database optimised for its exploitation in combination with satellite data, allowing the ingestion of observations and the planning of experimental campaigns in line with remote sensing acquisitions from the different missions, ensuring a consistent data format and schema.

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19Xb3JraW5nIG9uIHJl.text: Working on remote sensing for ocean plastic detection?

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19DYXJyeWluZyBvdXQg.text: Carrying out campaigns for ocean plastic surveying?

cHJvamVjdC1jb250ZW50c19HZXQgaW52b2x2ZWQg.text: Get involved and participate today with full credit and recognition.
